intro: Seseli tenuifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
